account.description: The account to connect to as per Snowflake's documentation.

user.description: The user to log in as.

role.description: The role to assume when running queries as the specified user.

database.description: The database that dbt should create models in.

warehouse.description: The warehouse to use when building models.

schema.description: The schema to build models into by default. Can be overridden with custom schemasF.

threads.description: The number of concurrent models dbt should build. Set this to a higher number if using a bigger warehouse.

client_session_keep_alive.description: If True, the snowflake client will keep connections for longer than the default 4 hours. This is helpful when particularly long-running queries are executing (> 4 hours).

query_tag.description: A value with which to tag all queries, for later searching in QUERY_HISTORY view.

connect_retries.description: The number of times to retry after an unsuccessful connection.

connect_timeout.description: The number of seconds to sleep between failed connection retries.

retry_on_database_errors.description: A boolean flag indicating whether to retry after encountering errors of type snowflake.connector.errors.DatabaseError.

retry_all.description: A boolean flag indicating whether to retry on all Snowflake connector errors.

reuse_connections.description: A boolean flag indicating whether to reuse idle connections to help reduce total connections opened.
